title: And So It Begins
quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately... and see if I could not learn what it had to teach.
author: Henry David Thoreau

title: Of Wolf and Man
quote: If you live among wolves you have to act like a wolf.
author: Nikita Khrushchev

title: The Talons of Fear
quote: Extinction is the rule. Survival is the exception.
author: Carl Sagan

title: Stalked
quote: Hunger, love, pain, fear are some of those inner forces which rule the individual's instinct for self preservation.
author: Albert Einstein

title: Winds of Hell
quote: The strong survive, but the courageous triumph.
author: Michael Scott

title: Rain of Terror
quote: Extraordinary people survive under the most terrible circumstances and they become more extraordinary because of it.
author: Robertson Davies

title: The Hunger
quote: Humans are not the fastest or the strongest animals on the planet, but when it comes to survival, we have had the unique advantage of being clever.
author: David Perlmutter

title: After the Rescue
quote: This is the chance in a lifetime. But it's not worth dying over.
author: Wayne

title: The Freeze
quote: If quick, I survive. If not quick, I am lost. This is 'death.'
author: Sun Tzu

title: Brokedown Palace
quote: Does anything in nature despair except man?
author: May Sarton

title: Triumph
quote: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

title: Once More Unto the Breach
quote: The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

title: The Knife's Edge
quote: The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure.
author: Christopher McCandless

title: The Beasts of the Night
quote: Use your fear... It can take you to a place where you store your courage.
author: Amelia Earhart

title: Hunger's Grip
quote: The instinct to survive will never change, neither will the human body's amazing ability to endure.
author: John 'Lofty' Wiseman

title: Storm Rising
quote: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

title: Adrift
quote: Voyaging through wildernesses is essential to the growth and maturity of the human spirit.
author: Steven Callahan

title: Trial By Fire
quote: In nature there are neither rewards nor punishments; there are consequences.
author: R.G. Ingersoll

title: The Ascent
quote: Why wilderness? Because we like the taste of freedom, because we like the smell of danger.
author: Edward Abbey

title: The Madness
quote: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
author: Albert Einstein

title: The Gamble
quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
author: Ernest Hemingway

title: Winter's Fury
quote: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

title: Into the Abyss
quote: You're never more alive than when you're almost dead.
author: Tim O'Brien

title: The End Game
quote: Endurance is not just the ability to bear a hard thing, but to turn it into glory.
author: William Barclay

title: A New Land
quote: The first virtue in a soldier is endurance; courage is only the second virtue.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

title: First Blood
quote: If people think nature is their friend, then they sure don't need an enemy.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

title: Eternal Darkness
quote: The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure.
author: Christopher McCandless

title: Outfoxed
quote: With foxes we must play the fox.
author: Thomas Fuller

title: The Lone Wolf
quote: Fortune always favors the brave, and never helps a man who does not help himself.
author: P. T. Barnum

title: Along Came a Spider
quote: All that an obstacle does with brave men is, not to frighten them, but to challenge them.
author: Woodrow Wilson

title: Hungry Beasts
quote: If you don't hunt it down and kill it, it will hunt you down and kill you.
author: Flannery O'Connor

title: Of Feast & Famine
quote: We are all sentenced to solitary confinement inside our own skins, for life.
author: Tennessee Williams

title: The Point of No Return
quote: Being alone is scary, but not as scary as feeling alone.
author: Amelia Earhart

title: Day 87
quote: I have often marveled at the thin line which separates success from failure.
author: Ernest Shackleton

title: Divide and Conquer
quote: Freedom is something that dies unless it's used.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

title: Hell on Earth
quote: The clearest way into the universe is through a forest wilderness
author: John Muir

title: Margin of Error
quote: Alone, we can do so little; together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

title: The Last Mile
quote: Without a family, man, alone in the world, trembles with the cold.
author: Andre Maurois

title: Double or Nothing
quote: Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success.
author: Henry Ford

title: Thicker Than Water
quote: Men argue. Nature acts.
author: Voltaire

title: Hooked
quote: Either men will learn to live like brothers, or they will die like beasts.
author: Max Lerner

title: Flare-Up
quote: Hell is other people.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

title: My Brother's Keeper
quote: The strength of the team is each individual member. The strength of each member is the team.
author: Phil Jackson

title: Flesh and Blood
quote: Heroism is endurance for one moment more.
author: George F. Kennan

title: Redemption
quote: Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: The Haunting
quote: All men make mistakes, but only wise men learn from their mistakes.
author: Winston Churchill

title: The Serpent
quote: It is not the mountains we conquer, but ourselves.
author: Sir Edmund Hillary

title: Mongolia's Wrath
quote: Nature, in her untamed state, is savage and unrelenting.
author: Fennel Hudson

title: The Bowels Of Hell
quote: Over every mountain there is a path, though it may not be seen from the valley.
author: Theodore Roethke

title: Of Mice And Men
quote: ...we do not own these woods. They own us.
author: Timothy Goodwin

title: Desperate Measures
quote: Redemption can be found in hell itself if that's where you happen to be.
author: Lin Jensen

title: Slayer II
quote: Solitude, isolation are painful things, and beyond human endurance.
author: Jules Verne

title: Starvation's Shadow
quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.
author: John Muir

title: Cold War
quote: By endurance we conquer.
author: Ernest Shackleton

title: Icebreaker
quote: Our food lies ahead and death stalks us from behind.
author: Ernest Shackleton

title: Tainted
quote: Laws change; people die; the land remains.
author: Abraham Lincoln

title: Up In Flames
quote: This is no time for ease and comfort. It is the time to dare and endure.
author: Winston Churchill

title: The Moose
quote: A failure is not always a mistake... The real mistake is to stop trying.
author: B.F. Skinner

title: The Kill
quote: For suffering and enduring there is no remedy but striving and doing.
author: Thomas Carlyle

title: Ablaze
quote: The most difficult thing is the decision to act. The rest is merely tenacity.
author: Amelia Earhart

title: Night Raider
quote: Come what may, all bad fortune is to be conquered by endurance.
author: Virgil

title: Out Cold
quote: He who conquers others is strong. He who conquers himself is mighty.
author: Lao Tzu

title: The Ice Cometh
quote: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
author: Aeschylus

title: Thin Ice
quote: Adapt or perish, now as ever, is nature's inexorable imperative.
author: H.G. Wells

title: Fire and Ice
quote: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
author: Sigmund Freud

title: Million Dollar Mistake
quote: Whosoever is delighted in solitude is either a wild beast or a god.
author: Aristotle

title: The Rock House
quote: Fortitude is the marshal of thought, the armor of the will, and the fort of reason.
author: Francis Bacon

title: That Was No Bunny
quote: Life is a walk through the forest. Don't fear the trees; fear what lurks behind them.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich

title: The Fly
quote: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food.
author: Hippocrates

title: The Rock
quote: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
author: John Wooden

title: The Musk Ox
quote: Chaos was the law of nature; Order was the dream of man.
author: Henry Adams

title: Snared
quote: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

title: Up In Smoke
quote: To survive it is often necessary to fight and to fight you have to dirty yourself.
author: George Orwell

title: The Wolves
quote: Let me not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless in facing them.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

title: Pins and Needles
quote: Fate leads the willing, and drags along the reluctant.
author: Seneca

title: Over the Edge
quote: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

title: The Hunted
quote: The worst cruelty that can be inflicted on a human being is isolation.
author: Sukarno

title: Open Season
quote: True wilderness can still be found, but it's hard to reach and dangerous when you get there.
author: Michelle Paver

title: Chewed Up
quote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
author: Seneca

title: Far From Home
quote: Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

title: The Buck
quote: Only by going alone in silence, without baggage, can one truly get into the heart of the wilderness.
author: John Muir

title: Smoked
quote: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
author: Robert Collier

title: Surrounded
quote: In nature there are neither rewards nor punishments; there are consequences.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

title: The Grizzly
quote: I think nature's imagination is so much greater than man's, she's never going to let us relax.
author: Richard Feyman [sic]

title: The Troll
quote: We have nowhere else to go… This is all we have.
author: Margaret Mead

title: All In
quote: Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents which in prosperous circumstances would have lain dormant.
author: Horace

title: The Reckoning
quote: The rewards for those who persevere far exceed the pain that must precede the victory.
author: Ted Engstrom

title: Drop Shock
quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

title: Consequences
quote: Don't feel entitled to anything you didn't sweat and struggle for.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

title: The Law of the Land
quote: The future depends on what we do in the present.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

title: The Beaver
quote: It's on the strength of observation and reflection that one finds a way.
author: Claude Monet

title: The Land Giveth…
quote: One thorn of experience is worth a whole wilderness of warning.
author: James Russell Lowell

title: The Weasel
quote: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
author: George Bernard Shaw

title: The Birds
quote: And into the forest I go, to lose my mind and find my soul.
author: John Muir

title: Gut Feeling
quote: Never to suffer would never to have been blessed.
author: Edgar Allen Poe [sic]

title: The Ice Up
quote: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

title: Winter's Grasp
quote: Solitude was my only consolation - deep, dark, deathlike solitude.
author: Mary Shelley

title: Fight, Flight or Freeze
quote: Out of difficulties grow miracles.
author: Jean de La Bruyère

title: Episode 1
quote: Travellers, there is no path. Paths are made by walking.
author: Antonio Machado

title: Episode 2
quote: There's no harm in hoping for the best as long as you're perpared for the worst.
author: Stephen King

title: Episode 3
quote: Hunger is the handmaid of genius.
author: Mark Twain

title: Episode 4
quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
author: Ernest Hemingway

title: Episode 5
quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how
author: Fredirich Nietzsche

title: Episode 6
quote: The important thing in life is not the triumph but the struggle
author: Pierre de Coubertin

title: Episode 7
quote: There's something to be said for hunger: at least it lets you know you're still alive
author: Margaret Atwood

title: Episode 8
quote: Solitude, Isolation, are painful things, and beyond human endurance.
author: Jules Verne

title: Episode 9
quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
author: Thomas Edison

title: Episode 10
quote: By endurance we conquer.
author: Earnest Shackleton

title: Episode 11
quote: By endurance we conquer.
author: Earnest Shackleton

title: Game On
quote: The pathway to glory is rough, and many gloomy hours obscure it.
author: Chief Black Hawk

title: Ties that Bind
quote: Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.
author: Sun Tzu

title: Growing Pains
quote: Going to the mountains is going home.
author: John Muir

title: Lake of Theives
quote: We first make our habits, then our habits make us.
author: John Dryden

title: Spirit Bears
quote: The art of life is a constant readjustment our surroundings.
author: Okakura Kakuzo

title: King's Gambit
quote: When patterns are broken, new worlds emerge.
author: Tuli Kupferberg

title: Aftermath
quote: We may encounter defeats, but we must not be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

title: Infestation
quote: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
author: Walter Elliot

title: Splintered
quote: Man is not what he thinks he is, he is what he hides.
author: Andre Malraux

title: Rats
quote: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
author: Kenji Miyazawa

title: By Any Means
quote: Buck up, do your damnedest, and fight.
author: Robert Service
